Directions: Use the information below to answer each question that follows.
Content: Four types of fossils of extinct species are found in two locations. Paleontologists can gather important information about organisms from these species and the environment in which they lived.

Figure 1 shows the types of fossils that were found at each location and the time period when the species of the organisms that created the fossils lived. The key indicates if each organism lived in a marine or land environment.
